intro: Zygosicyos hirtellus, commonly known as the African bottle tree, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, characterized by its unique, bottle-shaped trunk and sprawling, vine-like growth habit. Native to tropical Africa, this plant features large, heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Its fruit is a thick-walled, fleshy capsule that contains numerous seeds, often used in traditional medicine and as a food source. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that allow it to survive in dry conditions. Its distinctive morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitats.
